programme.title: Champions League Final 1993
programme.desc: We revisit the 1993 final between Marseille and AC Milan at Munich's Olympiastadion. The occasion was later overshadowed by one of the biggest scandals in the sport's history.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1994
programme.desc: A look back at the extraordinary 1994 final at the Olympic Stadium in Athens between Fabio Capello's AC Milan and Barcelona, managed by Johan Cruyff and dubbed the 'Dream Team'.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1995
programme.desc: We revisit the 1995 final in Vienna between Louis van Gaal's Ajax and AC Milan. A star-studded Ajax team featured Edwin van der Sar, Ronald and Frank de Boer, and Edgar Davids.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1996
programme.desc: We revisit the 1996 final between Ajax and Juventus in Rome. Juve's talented side included Didier Deschamps, Antonio Conte and Gianluca Vialli - all at the height of their powers.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1998
programme.desc: Real Madrid went in search of their seventh European Cup title when they faced Juventus in the 1998 final in Amsterdam. The Serie A winners featured a 25-year-old Zinedine Zidane.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2001
programme.desc: We revisit the dramatic 2000/01 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Valencia at the San Siro in Milan. Bayern were chasing their first title in a quarter-century.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2003
programme.desc: We revisit the 2002/03 UEFA Champions League final between Juventus and AC Milan at Old Trafford. Paolo Maldini aimed to lift the trophy as captain, just as his father did in 1963.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2004
programme.desc: We revisit the 2003/04 UEFA Champions League final between Monaco and Porto in Gelsenkirchen. Jose Mourinho would leave Porto to take over at Chelsea just days later.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2007
programme.desc: We rewind back to the 2006/07 UEFA Champions League final at the Olympic Stadium in Athens as AC Milan looked to avenge their defeat two years previously against the Reds.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2009
programme.desc: A look back at the 2009 UEFA Champions League final between Barcelona and Man Utd in Rome. United were bidding to become the first team to defend the trophy in the modern era.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2010
programme.desc: We revisit the 2010 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Inter Milan at the Bernabeu. Jose Mourinho was looking to become the third man to win it with two clubs.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2013
programme.desc: We revisit the all-German 2013 UEFA Champions League final between Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich at Wembley. Bayern had lost two finals in three years.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2015
programme.desc: We revisit the enthralling 2014/15 UEFA Champions League final between Juventus and Barcelona in Berlin. Barcelona were chasing their third Champions League title in six years.

programme.title: Barcelona v Man Utd 1994/95
programme.desc: We revisit the 1994/95 UEFA Champions League group stage tie between Barcelona and Man Utd at the Nou Camp. Johan Cruyff's 'Dream Team' featured Hristo Stoichkov and Romario.

programme.title: Man Utd v Barcelona 1998/99
programme.desc: We revisit the 1998/99 UEFA Champions League group stage epic between Man Utd and Barcelona at Old Trafford. This end-to-end game featured six goals, two penalties and a red card.

programme.title: Jack Stein: Born to Cook

programme.desc: Methamphetamine is found in a shipment of broccoli, an elderly man tries to smuggle pills in protein powder, and a woman receives a humanitarian visa to see her dying son.

programme.desc: Money and guns belonging to a cartel are found in a car, an illegal shipment of exotic reptiles is discovered in a van, and a man is caught smuggling medication.

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Mahoneys spend thousands of dollars on a loader for a final push at 8-Mile, and Alex is convinced there's big gold at Relief Creek. The Gold Gypsies strike it lucky. S3, Ep11

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: With the season close to ending, the Dirt Dogs struggle to hunt out their final $350,000 of gold. The Mahoneys bring in machinery in a final effort to hit their target. S3, Ep12

programme.title: Yukon Gold
programme.desc: Big Al takes some dangerous risks to move his sluice plant. Ken faces penalties for being behind on payments, and Cam's second mine is in trouble. S2, Ep3

programme.title: Yukon Gold

programme.desc: Junior Bake Off is back as more young bakers take to the tent. It's Cake Day, and the first heat of bakers make purr-fect cat cakes and reveal their wishes in a burn-away cake.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Cheddar: Santiago and Peralta house-sit for Captain Holt when he visits Kevin in Paris and mayhem ensues when Holt's beloved dog goes missing on their watch.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Terry Kitties: Jeffords enlists Peralta's help to solve a case from his past. Santiago invites herself to a competitive training exercise with Holt and Diaz.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Roulette Wheel and a Piano Playing Dog: Sheldon realises that he's the weakest student in his class, and Meemaw sets out to expand her gambling business.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Strudel and a Hot American Boy Toy: Sheldon explores Germany behind Mary's back, Missy attempts to pull a fast one on George Sr, and Meemaw and Dale adjust.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Griffin Equivalency: Full of confidence after being named one of People magazine's '30 to Watch Under 30', Raj hits on Penny and becomes impossibly arrogant.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Euclid Alternative: When Leonard can't drive Sheldon to and from work, the friends stage an intervention to overcome Sheldon's fear of getting behind the wheel.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Strangers in the Night: When Alex tells Phil and Claire she has a boyfriend, they worry that they've put too much pressure on her and that she's made up an imaginary boyfriend.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Haley's 21st Birthday: The family take Haley to a bar to celebrate her 21st birthday. Can Claire convince Haley to see her as a friend, rather than as her uptight mum?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Skank Reflex Analysis: Penny worries that she's screwed things up with her friends after her night with Raj. Sheldon takes command of the paintball team.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Infestation Hypothesis: Amy is stuck in the middle of a battle of wills between Penny and Sheldon. Leonard and Priya try to spice up their long-distance relationship.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Pulled Groin Extrapolation: Leonard goes to a colleague's wedding as Amy's date. Howard tries to convince Bernadette to live with his mum after they get married.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Wiggly Finger Catalyst: Raj begins to get upset that he's the only one of the four guys not in a relationship, so Penny sets out to find him the perfect date.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Halloween IV: On Halloween night, the squad members follow precinct tradition and compete for the title of Ultimate Detective Slash Genius.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Monster in the Closet: When Pimento and Diaz decide to tie the knot, the squad members try to prepare the perfect wedding under Santiago's careful direction.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Integrity: Phil and Jay run an errand together to pick up Lily's hand-me-down princess castle for Joe. Phil is upset that Claire won't let him buy a videogame console.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Patriot Games: Alex faces her worst nightmare: having to share the Valedictorian title with her number one competitor, Sunjay.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A New Home and a Traditional Texas Torture: George Sr gets an exciting job offer, and Sheldon prepares for his move to California.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Funeral: Young Sheldon ends with a two-episode finale. Sheldon leaves East Texas for the California Institute of Technology, following a family bereavement.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Transporter Malfunction: Penny buys Leonard and Sheldon some Star Trek memorabilia, but she is irked when they refuse to remove the toys from their packaging.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Hawking Excitation: When Stephen Hawking comes to lecture at the university, Howard is given the task of maintaining his wheelchair, which makes Sheldon envious.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Stag Convergence: Leonard, Sheldon and Raj throw a bachelor party for Howard, during which some stories about his sexual history are accidentally revealed.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brother's Little Helper: An experimental ADHD drug improves Bart's behaviour but makes him paranoid: is Major League Baseball using a satellite to read his thoughts?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The walls are closing in on Abe, but will justice be served? There's nowhere for Dillon to hide. And at the hospital, Cleo's eyes open...

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: SuperShowerBabyBowl: Jay is hosting a Super Bowl party, while Claire hosts a baby shower for Haley - and they're both at Jay's house. What could possibly go wrong?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Replaceable You: When Homer loses his job to his eager new assistant, he teams up with Ned to reveal her evil past.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Food Wife: An unexpected restaurant detour inspires Marge, Lisa and Bart to start their own food blog.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: From Love Island to The Family Brain Game, what do Oti Mabuse, Rachel Riley, Rylan Clark-Neal, Denise van Outen, Emily Atack, Nick Grimshaw and other celebs think of our top TV?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britain's sharpest armchair critics watch: I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!, Hollyoaks, Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy, Queens for the Night, and University Challenge.

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: Cowboys & Aliens
programme.desc: (2011) Sci-fi western starring Daniel Craig and Harrison Ford. A brutal cattle baron and his amnesiac enemy must cease their feuding when a town is attacked by aliens.

programme.title: Bad Boys
programme.desc: (1995) Action comedy with Martin Lawrence, Will Smith and Ta Leoni. Can two cops catch a drugs lord, keep a witness alive and fend off Internal Affairs?

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: (2019) Horror based on Stephen King's novel. Seeking a quiet life, a family moves to a rural setting. But there's a road with speeding trucks and a pet cemetery that resurrects the dead...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Dora and the Lost City of Gold
programme.desc: (2019) Family adventure with Isabela Moner, Eva Longoria and Michael Pea. Everyone's favourite young explorer must track down her parents, who are missing in Peru.

programme.title: Daleks Invasion Earth 2150 A.D.
programme.desc: (1966) A sci-fi classic with Peter Cushing. Dr Who travels to the future only to find the Daleks have conquered the Earth! Can he stop them nuking the planet's core? With Bernard Cribbins.

programme.title: Secret Headquarters
programme.desc: (2022) Family comedy with Michael Pea. A young lad discovers that his lax dad is in fact a superhero. Then, with no time to process, he must foil a villain's plot to bring his daddy down.

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: (2007) Supernatural thriller. Alexander Ludwig stars as The Seeker, who has the task of finding six items hidden throughout time, which the scary forces of The Dark are also looking for.

programme.title: We Live in Time Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.title: Taxi
programme.desc: (2004) All-action thriller. Queen Latifah stars as the driver of the fastest taxi in New York, who teams up with an inept cop (Jimmy Fallon) to catch a team of female bank-robbers.

programme.title: The Mechanic
programme.desc: (2011) Thriller with Jason Statham and Donald Sutherland. A hitman is ordered to kill his mentor, but then takes on the dead man's son as an apprentice. Could get complicated... and deadly.

programme.title: No Exit
programme.desc: (2022) Thriller. A recovering addict ends up stranded at a remote visitor centre in a snowstorm with four strangers, then finds a kidnapped girl in the car park. Question is: who did it?

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: (2021) Crime thriller with Neil Maskell. A ferocious mob enforcer returns from exile to wreak revenge on the people who double crossed him. But really he just wants his boy back. Bless.

programme.title: Slice
programme.desc: (2018) Gory comedy horror. When a pizza delivery boy gets murdered in a town with a large population of ghosts, who's gonna get blamed? But his girlfriend kicks ass and won't let it lie.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: BSL Zone: Small World
programme.desc: Sitcom. When their new flatmates arrive, Deaf ex-students Ryan and Alfonso realise the deaf world is a small world. Ep1/5

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Enemy Mine
programme.desc: (1985) Sci-fi adventure starring Dennis Quaid and Louis Gossett Jr. A human and his alien enemy find themselves stranded alone on a hostile planet, where they must work together to survive.

programme.title: It Came from Beneath the Sea
programme.desc: (1955) Creature feature. Kenneth Tobey stars as the captain of a nuclear submarine who comes across a giant, tentacled beast that is fiercely determined to destroy San Francisco.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: (1957) Western starring Randolph Scott and John Carroll. A man seeking revenge on the person who took his wife, who later killed herself, tracks his quarry to the sleepy town of Sundown.

programme.title: Picnic
programme.desc: (1955) William Holden and Kim Novak star in this sweltering tale of deception, betrayal and illicit love in small-town Kansas.

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: (2004) Drama. Dennis Quaid stars as the captain of an aircraft downed in the desert. There's no hope of rescue, unless he and the survivors can build another plane from the wreckage.

programme.title: We Live in Time Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost...
programme.desc: ...Protocol: (2011) Part four of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The Impossible Missions Force fight to clear their name, while also trying to avert nuclear war. Busy, busy, busy!
(2014) Drama with Jack O'Connell as a young British soldier who finds himself in deep trouble when he's separated from his unit during a violent riot while serving in west Belfast in 1971.

programme.title: Snatched
programme.desc: (2017) Outrageous comedy with Amy Schumer and Goldie Hawn. After losing her job and being cruelly dumped, a woman takes an incident-packed holiday in South America with her cautious mum.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Cover Girl
programme.desc: (1944) Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly star in Charles Vidor's Technicolor comedy musical about a chorus girl's rise to fame. Featuring songs and a score from Jerome Kern and Ira Gershwin.

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
programme.desc: (1970) Oscar-winning drama portraying the bombing of Pearl Harbor, from both American and Japanese perspectives. With Joseph Cotten and So Yamamura.

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: (1959) Fantasy adventure starring James Mason, Pat Boone and Diane Baker. An expedition to the centre of the planet unexpectedly encounters a villainous rival and prehistoric beasts.

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: (1998) Elijah Wood and Morgan Freeman star in the sci-fi disaster movie about impending meteorite-related disaster, attempts to destroy it, and possibly some cataclysmic havoc.

programme.title: The G
programme.desc: (2023) Gritty crime thriller with Dale Dickey. An elderly couple get fleeced for their house and savings, so granny - aka The G - goes on a vengeful rampage. Be careful who you mess with.

programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: (2014) Tense thriller with Tom Hardy, James Gandolfini, Noomi Rapace and Matthias Schoenaerts. Two cousins get into trouble with the gangsters who use their bar to launder illicit cash.

programme.desc: (2011) Sci-fi western starring Daniel Craig and Harrison Ford. A brutal cattle baron and his amnesiac enemy must cease their feuding when a town is attacked by aliens.

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Blackburn Rovers v Burnley at Ewood Park, Hull City v Leeds United at MKM Stadium and Watford v Sheffield United at Vicarage Road in the Championship

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: The death of 19-year-old Sophie Chalcott, the daughter of the UK minister for trade, sparks international interest after her body is found floating in Sydney harbour the morning after a lavish party on a boat. British detective Max Drummond arrives in Sydney to find a complex homicide investigation under way and clashes immediately with DS Meg Driscoll on her first murder case as lead detective. Thriller, starring John Bradley, Joanne Froggatt and Kirsty Sturgess

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott return with more recipes, beginning by exploring the flavours of the Middle East, starting with chicken torsh, a traditional sweet and sour Persian kebab. Lisa Snowdon pays a visit to Nilly's Turkish to find out what makes her wraps so popular, before cooking up her own dish inspired by the flavours she finds. Back in the kitchen, Ainsley is joined by Kate Lawler, who whips up a mega salad and has a secret halloumi hack

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett is back with the singing contest in which the celebrity panel must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. Returning panellists Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan are joined by Maya Jama, and this opening episode sees the first six of the 12 mystery celebrities battling it out as Teeth, Snail, Tattoo, Kingfisher, Spag Bol and Dressed Crab take to the stage

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and welcomes in 2025 by serving up a feast of mouth watering recipes for Gloria Hunniford and enjoying dishes from chefs Galton Blackiston and Tommy Banks.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by actress and comedian Kerry Godliman and actor Martin Shaw, while horticulturists Camilla Bassett Smith and Jamie Butterworth join forces to tackle a new year garden challenge and landscape artist Chris Cyprus creates a new masterpiece for the barn. Plus, social media star Sam Wolfenden shares his passion for farriery, there is bird-spotting with wildlife expert David Lindo, and Ian Burrell is back behind the bar serving up the very best winter rum cocktails

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: The big day arrives as the Fletchers compete in the Royal Cheshire Show with their cows Cherry and Sonic, but with only four weeks of cow ownership under their belts, how well will they do? Marnie's calf starts playing up as he becomes overwhelmed by the noise of the crowd, while Milo enters the young handler contest, and emotions are high for Kelvin and Liz as the show comes to a close

programme.title: The Royal Beat
programme.desc: Kate Thornton is joined by journalists Roya Nikkhah, Russell Myers and Emily Nash to discuss all of the latest news surrounding the royal family

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Goonies
programme.desc: Adventure based on a story by Steven Spielberg, starring Sean Astin, Corey Feldman and Martha Plimpton. While clearing out an attic, a gang of boys known as the "Goonies" come across a map revealing the location of a long-lost galleon. But when they begin their search for the vessel, they find the evil Mama Fratelli standing in the way of a fantastic adventure.

programme.title: Sing 2
programme.desc: Animated musical comedy featuring the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon and Scarlett Johansson. Music promoter Buster Moon books a major show for his singing troupe - but only on the proviso that he can track down and hire a reclusive rock legend.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the remaining six incognito celebrities enter the competition, with Pufferfish, Bush, Wolf, Pegasus, Toad in the Hole and Bear taking to the stage. Special guest Vicky McClure joins panellists Maya Jama, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan and the true identity of one of the disguised famous faces is revealed at the end of the show

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Steve is back to finish his game with son-in-law Jordan, hoping to win enough money to get him and step-daughter Megan out of the house and set them up with a home of their own. Husband-and-wife team Richard and Lorna then face the Limitless Ladder looking to win some major money - they've been doing some proper homework, but can they translate it into hard cash?

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete and Maddie find out that their son Theo was swapped at birth with another boy in a hospital mix-up. Will Theo's real parents want him back or will the couples be able to sort things out amicably? Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: No Time to Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig, Rami Malek and La Seydoux. After narrowly surviving an attempt on his life, James Bond believes his lover, Madeleine Swann, has betrayed him. Five years later, he is drawn out of retirement and back into her life when a new global threat - a deadly biological weapon - emerges. But with Bond's nemesis, Blofeld, behind bars, who is the mysterious figure intent on using this terrifying new technology?

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Brands Hatch GP, with racing from the Porsche Sprint Challenge Great Britain and the ROKiT F4 British Championship

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.desc: The big day arrives as the Fletchers compete in the Royal Cheshire Show with their cows Cherry and Sonic, but with only four weeks of cow ownership under their belts, how well will they do? Marnie's calf starts playing up as he becomes overwhelmed by the noise of the crowd, while Milo enters the young handler contest, and emotions are high for Kelvin and Liz as the show comes to a close

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Looking back at some of the most dramatic end games in Tipping history, including agonising trades and jackpot counters teetering on the edge...

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show where two teams of three players compete against each other trying to guess the correct word or phrase represented by the drawings of their team-mates. Mel is joined by Denise Van Outen and Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen as the players draw and their team members guess

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the quiz in which three pairs of contestants use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords, with the last remaining duo having the opportunity to double the money they've banked. This edition features sisters Moina and Shazia, Ashleigh and her dad Brent, and couple Ian and Laura

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show as contestant Alex tries to open the 22 red boxes in the right order, taking on the infamous Banker for the chance to win a life-changing cash prize

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Mark from Widnes, Cat from Leeds, Elliot from Manchester and Doyin from London pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Suspicious Dawn points the finger, Rhona is still upset with Marlon, and Jacob is overwhelmed

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: With Betsy still refusing to believe in his innocence, Mason prepares to leave Weatherfield to escape his brothers. However, Matty and Logan soon track him down, and Dylan and Abi get caught in the fallout

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete and Maddie begin the fight to keep Theo, but it's an expensive and painful process and the constant dredging up of their past starts to damage their relationship. Can they survive? Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Mr Bates vs the Post Office: The Impact
programme.desc: In January 2024, the drama series Mr Bates vs The Post Office brought the story of the faulty Horizon computer and the subpostmasters wrongfully accused of theft to a national audience. In this follow-up documentary, the former subpostmasters and subpostmistresses involved talk about the impact of the drama, while more come forward to tell their heart-breaking stories for the first time. Narrated by Toby Jones

programme.title: Vera, Farewell Pet
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes to examine the appeal of ITV detective drama Vera as it comes to an end after 13 years. Brenda Blethyn reflects on her time as DCI Vera Stanhope, and talks about the camaraderie and joy of working on the show. Featuring interviews from key cast members - David Leon (DS Joe Ashworth), Jon Morrison (DC Kenny Lockhart), the directors, crew, and author Ann Cleeves, Vera's creator

programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as Daniel tries to open the 22 red boxes in the right order, taking on the infamous Banker for the chance to win a life-changing cash prize

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Stephen from Lincolnshire, Chynna from London, Rob from Newcastle and Carol from Ceredigion pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn is raging, Jacob is aware his stress is out of control, and Marlon is convinced to take action

programme.title: EFL Cup Live
programme.desc: Arsenal v Newcastle United (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the opening semi-final first-leg tie, held at Emirates Stadium. The Gunners are looking to lift this trophy for the first time since the 1992/93 season, and a hat-trick from Gabriel Jesus helped them to a 3-2 win over Crystal Palace here in the previous round. Newcastle have never won this competition, but they were runners-up for the second time two seasons ago when they lost to Manchester United. This time around, they were 3-1 home winners over Brentford in the last eight, having also overcome Chelsea in the fourth round

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Britain's Notorious Prisons: Strangeways
programme.desc: Featuring first-hand testimony from past inmates and staff, this documentary tells the truth about life behind the walls of Manchester's Strangeways Prison, one of Britain's most notorious jails. It includes the story of the most brutal riot in UK history, when the inmates took over. David Morrissey narrates

programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Blackburn Rovers v Burnley at Ewood Park, Hull City v Leeds United at MKM Stadium and Watford v Sheffield United at Vicarage Road in the Championship

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: The death of 19-year-old Sophie Chalcott, the daughter of the UK minister for trade, sparks international interest after her body is found floating in Sydney harbour the morning after a lavish party on a boat. British detective Max Drummond arrives in Sydney to find a complex homicide investigation under way and clashes immediately with DS Meg Driscoll on her first murder case as lead detective. Thriller, starring John Bradley, Joanne Froggatt and Kirsty Sturgess

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott return with more recipes, beginning by exploring the flavours of the Middle East, starting with chicken torsh, a traditional sweet and sour Persian kebab. Lisa Snowdon pays a visit to Nilly's Turkish to find out what makes her wraps so popular, before cooking up her own dish inspired by the flavours she finds. Back in the kitchen, Ainsley is joined by Kate Lawler, who whips up a mega salad and has a secret halloumi hack

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett is back with the singing contest in which the celebrity panel must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. Returning panellists Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan are joined by Maya Jama, and this opening episode sees the first six of the 12 mystery celebrities battling it out as Teeth, Snail, Tattoo, Kingfisher, Spag Bol and Dressed Crab take to the stage

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and welcomes in 2025 by serving up a feast of mouth watering recipes for Gloria Hunniford and enjoying dishes from chefs Galton Blackiston and Tommy Banks.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by actress and comedian Kerry Godliman and actor Martin Shaw, while horticulturists Camilla Bassett Smith and Jamie Butterworth join forces to tackle a new year garden challenge and landscape artist Chris Cyprus creates a new masterpiece for the barn. Plus, social media star Sam Wolfenden shares his passion for farriery, there is bird-spotting with wildlife expert David Lindo, and Ian Burrell is back behind the bar serving up the very best winter rum cocktails

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: The big day arrives as the Fletchers compete in the Royal Cheshire Show with their cows Cherry and Sonic, but with only four weeks of cow ownership under their belts, how well will they do? Marnie's calf starts playing up as he becomes overwhelmed by the noise of the crowd, while Milo enters the young handler contest, and emotions are high for Kelvin and Liz as the show comes to a close

programme.title: The Royal Beat
programme.desc: Kate Thornton is joined by journalists Roya Nikkhah, Russell Myers and Emily Nash to discuss all of the latest news surrounding the royal family

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Goonies
programme.desc: Adventure based on a story by Steven Spielberg, starring Sean Astin, Corey Feldman and Martha Plimpton. While clearing out an attic, a gang of boys known as the "Goonies" come across a map revealing the location of a long-lost galleon. But when they begin their search for the vessel, they find the evil Mama Fratelli standing in the way of a fantastic adventure.

programme.title: Sing 2
programme.desc: Animated musical comedy featuring the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon and Scarlett Johansson. Music promoter Buster Moon books a major show for his singing troupe - but only on the proviso that he can track down and hire a reclusive rock legend.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the remaining six incognito celebrities enter the competition, with Pufferfish, Bush, Wolf, Pegasus, Toad in the Hole and Bear taking to the stage. Special guest Vicky McClure joins panellists Maya Jama, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan and the true identity of one of the disguised famous faces is revealed at the end of the show

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Steve is back to finish his game with son-in-law Jordan, hoping to win enough money to get him and step-daughter Megan out of the house and set them up with a home of their own. Husband-and-wife team Richard and Lorna then face the Limitless Ladder looking to win some major money - they've been doing some proper homework, but can they translate it into hard cash?

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete and Maddie find out that their son Theo was swapped at birth with another boy in a hospital mix-up. Will Theo's real parents want him back or will the couples be able to sort things out amicably? Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: No Time to Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig, Rami Malek and La Seydoux. After narrowly surviving an attempt on his life, James Bond believes his lover, Madeleine Swann, has betrayed him. Five years later, he is drawn out of retirement and back into her life when a new global threat - a deadly biological weapon - emerges. But with Bond's nemesis, Blofeld, behind bars, who is the mysterious figure intent on using this terrifying new technology?

The Gunners are looking to lift this trophy for the first time since the 1992/93 season, and a hat-trick from Gabriel Jesus helped them to a 3-2 win over Crystal Palace here in the previous round. Newcastle have never won this competition, but they were runners-up for the second time two seasons ago when they lost to Manchester United. This time around, they were 3-1 home winners over Brentford in the last eight, having also overcome Chelsea in the fourth round

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Britain's Notorious Prisons: Strangeways
programme.desc: Featuring first-hand testimony from past inmates and staff, this documentary tells the truth about life behind the walls of Manchester's Strangeways Prison, one of Britain's most notorious jails. It includes the story of the most brutal riot in UK history, when the inmates took over. David Morrissey narrates

programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Blackburn Rovers v Burnley at Ewood Park, Hull City v Leeds United at MKM Stadium and Watford v Sheffield United at Vicarage Road in the Championship

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: The death of 19-year-old Sophie Chalcott, the daughter of the UK minister for trade, sparks international interest after her body is found floating in Sydney harbour the morning after a lavish party on a boat. British detective Max Drummond arrives in Sydney to find a complex homicide investigation under way and clashes immediately with DS Meg Driscoll on her first murder case as lead detective. Thriller, starring John Bradley, Joanne Froggatt and Kirsty Sturgess

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott return with more recipes, beginning by exploring the flavours of the Middle East, starting with chicken torsh, a traditional sweet and sour Persian kebab. Lisa Snowdon pays a visit to Nilly's Turkish to find out what makes her wraps so popular, before cooking up her own dish inspired by the flavours she finds. Back in the kitchen, Ainsley is joined by Kate Lawler, who whips up a mega salad and has a secret halloumi hack

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett is back with the singing contest in which the celebrity panel must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. Returning panellists Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan are joined by Maya Jama, and this opening episode sees the first six of the 12 mystery celebrities battling it out as Teeth, Snail, Tattoo, Kingfisher, Spag Bol and Dressed Crab take to the stage

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and welcomes in 2025 by serving up a feast of mouth watering recipes for Gloria Hunniford and enjoying dishes from chefs Galton Blackiston and Tommy Banks.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by actress and comedian Kerry Godliman and actor Martin Shaw, while horticulturists Camilla Bassett Smith and Jamie Butterworth join forces to tackle a new year garden challenge and landscape artist Chris Cyprus creates a new masterpiece for the barn. Plus, social media star Sam Wolfenden shares his passion for farriery, there is bird-spotting with wildlife expert David Lindo, and Ian Burrell is back behind the bar serving up the very best winter rum cocktails

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: The big day arrives as the Fletchers compete in the Royal Cheshire Show with their cows Cherry and Sonic, but with only four weeks of cow ownership under their belts, how well will they do? Marnie's calf starts playing up as he becomes overwhelmed by the noise of the crowd, while Milo enters the young handler contest, and emotions are high for Kelvin and Liz as the show comes to a close

programme.title: The Goonies
programme.desc: Adventure based on a story by Steven Spielberg, starring Sean Astin, Corey Feldman and Martha Plimpton. While clearing out an attic, a gang of boys known as the "Goonies" come across a map revealing the location of a long-lost galleon. But when they begin their search for the vessel, they find the evil Mama Fratelli standing in the way of a fantastic adventure.

programme.title: Sing 2
programme.desc: Animated musical comedy featuring the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon and Scarlett Johansson. Music promoter Buster Moon books a major show for his singing troupe - but only on the proviso that he can track down and hire a reclusive rock legend.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win

Husband-and-wife team Richard and Lorna then face the Limitless Ladder looking to win some major money - they've been doing some proper homework, but can they translate it into hard cash?

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete and Maddie find out that their son Theo was swapped at birth with another boy in a hospital mix-up. Will Theo's real parents want him back or will the couples be able to sort things out amicably? Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

Five years later, he is drawn out of retirement and back into her life when a new global threat - a deadly biological weapon - emerges. But with Bond's nemesis, Blofeld, behind bars, who is the mysterious figure intent on using this terrifying new technology?
